title: Congress welcomes SC decision to stay ‘100-metre definition’ of Aravallis
content: The Congress had strongly opposed the redefinition and raised concerns over it, claiming that this would lead to destroying the hills by opening them to mining, real estate and other projects

title: Turmeric exports from Erode district see 5% rise thanks to sustained global demand
content: Known for its high curcumin content ranging between 2.5% and 3.9%, Erode turmeric has earned a Geographical Indication (GI) tag and remains one of the major crops cultivated in the district

title: Malayalam actor Jayasurya appears before ED in FEMA case probe
content: The actor, accompanied by his wife, is understood to have visited the agency's zonal office as part of a Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA) case probe

title: Skill Centre to be set up at KBN College within three months: MP Kesineni Sivanath
content: Addressing an alumni meet organised by the KBN College Old Students Association (KOSA), the MP called upon former students settled across India and abroad to actively contribute to Vijayawada’s development

title: AIMIM announces candidates for Thane, Vasai-Virar civic polls
content: “As of now, the party has finalised the names of five candidates from Mumbra in Thane city and three candidates from the Vasai-Virar region,” says AIMIM president Imtiaz Jaleel

title: Coinbase CEO says ex-employee arrested in India
content: Crypto exchange Coinbase’s CEO Brian Armstrong announced on social media that an ex-employee was arrested in India

title: LDF regains Pullur-Periya panchayat in Kerala’s Kasaragod after tie-break decided by lots
content: Draw of lots became necessary as both LDF and UDF secured nine votes each in the election. The tie occurred after an elected member abstained from voting

title: L&T bags order related to Hyderabad Greenfield Radial Road
content: Scope of work involves construction of a 3.6 km long viaduct, minor bridges, underpasses and culverts besides others

title: Unnao rape survivor welcomes SC order staying suspension of Kuldeep Sengar's life sentence
content: The Supreme Court on December 29, stayed the Delhi High Court order that had suspended Sengar's life sentence and granted him bail in the 2017 Unnao rape case

title: Four juveniles held for assaulting Maharashtra youth in Tamil Nadu’s Tiruvallur
content: The accused youths filmed the brutal assault and uploaded the videos on social media platforms in an attempt to make them go viral

title: Tezpur University unrest: Stakeholders stage 24-hr hunger strike to mark 100 days of protest
content: A joint forum of all stakeholders demands the removal of the beleaguered VC for his alleged involvement in corruption and other forms of irregularities, and the start of an inquiry into his actions.

title: Kerala local body polls: Agali panchayat president quits after Congress threatens legal action over election with LDF support
content: Elected from Chinnaparamba ward of Agali panchayat on Congress symbol, Manju became president on Saturday with the support of nine LDF members, drawing the ire of UDF

title: 2025: a year of landmark acquittals questioning credibility of terror convictions in India
content: In 2025, courts freed 19 men after years behind bars; Bombay High Court quashed convictions in the 7/11 Mumbai train blasts case, and a special NIA court acquitted all accused in the Malegaon case

title: Navi Mumbai police bust illegal overseas recruitment agency; seven booked
content: A probe has revealed that the accused were conducting recruitment activities for foreign jobs without a valid licence from the Ministry of External Affairs, an official says

title: Congress councillor Sabarinadhan echoes BJP’s Sreelekha, demands CPI(M) MLA V.K. Prasanth to vacate office in Kerala capital
content: In a Facebook post, Sabarinadhan says Prasanth should be using the facilities in the MLA hostel allotted in his name

title: Supreme Court puts its November expert report in abeyance in Aravalli hills case
content: A Bench led by Justice Surya Kant, along with Justices J.K. Maheshwari and A.G. Masih, said a fair, impartial and independent expert opinion must be obtained before any report or court direction is implemented

title: INSV Kaundinya: Navy’s engineless ship sets sail for Oman on maiden voyage
content: INSV Kaundinya’s project was undertaken through a tripartite agreement between the Ministry of Culture, the Indian Navy and Hodi Innovations as part of India’s efforts to rediscover and revive indigenous knowledge systems.

title: Supreme Court stays Unnao rape convict Sengar’s suspension of life sentence
content: Solicitor General Tushar Mehta, appearing for the CBI, argued that Sengar was in a position of dominance and found guilty under POCSO and of killing the victim’s father

title: NCP (SP), NCP join hands for Pune civic polls
content: "After NCP (SP) city chief Prashant Jagtap's exit from party, several workers came to working president Supriya Sule, saying both factions have to come together. decision about the alliance has been taken considering sentiments of local party workers," says NCP leader Rohit Pawar

title: ‘Is death of 33 BLOs okay?’ MP Kapil Sibal takes dig at government
content: Mr. Sibal's remarks came a day after a Booth Level Officer (BLO) was found dead in West Bengal's Bankura district, triggering allegations that work-related pressure linked to the ongoing Special Intensive Revision (SIR)

title: Tripura student murder: Tipra party wing announces ₹10 lakh reward for info on prime accused
content: Tipra Motha Party (TMP)-run Tripura Tribal Areas Autonomous District Council (TTAADC) on Dec 29 announced a compensation of ₹3 lakh to the family members of the deceased

title: Two youths arrested for sexually abusing minor at rented flat in Kerala’s Kozhikode
content: Police sources said the two reportedly took the girl to rented flat offering food and free stay on Sunday. She was later drugged and sexually abused

title: Adityanath orders closure of schools across Uttar Pradesh till January 1 amid cold wave
content: “The safety of children is paramount during the cold wave, and any negligence in this regard will not be tolerated,” says UP CM Adityanath

title: Alaknanda: Indian astronomers spot implausibly old spiral galaxy
content: Alaknanda’s existence poses a significant puzzle for astronomers: it took shape when the universe was only about 1.5 billion years old, defying current models of galaxy formation. According to one expert, either the galaxy grew steadily by drawing in cold gas or it interacted or merged with a smaller companion galaxy

title: Real estate development opened up by Rajasthan's double-engine govt to hurt Aravallis more: Congress
content: "It is not just mining but real estate development that is being opened up by the double-engine sarkar in New Delhi-Jaipur against the recommendations of the Forest Survey of India," Mr. Ramesh said in a post on X

title: Unnao rape case hearing: SC stays suspension of Kuldeep Singh Sengar's sentence, orders legal aid for survivor
content: The Supreme Court also said that there is ambiguity on the definition of ‘public servant’ under the POCSO; issues notice

title: Aravalli hills hearing updates: Supreme Court keeps its November judgment in abeyance
content: The court issues notice to be heard again on January 21; CJI says a new committee has to be formed to do the survey and study on Aravalli hills

title: Delhi airport sees 128 flight cancellations, 8 diversions due to fog
content: Delhi airport operator said runway visibility is improving, but some flight departures and arrivals may be impacted

title: Chhattisgarh: ED conducts raids in Bharatmala project land acquisition case
content: The case pertains to alleged irregularities in the payment of compensation for the acquisition of land for the Raipur-Vishakhapatnam economic corridor

title: Protests erupt in Tripura over murder of student Angel Chakma in Uttarakhand
content: Angel Chakma, a student from Tripura who was severely assaulted in Dehradun, the capital of Uttarakhand, and later died in the hospital

title: Tamil Nadu Teens Attack Migrant Worker With Machete, Leave Him Bloodied
content: Three accused were sent to a juvenile home in Chengalpattu, while the fourth one was released on bail, with the court citing his studies.

title: Rift Within Bangladesh's Student-Led Party Widens Over Jamaat Alliance
content: National Citizen Party (NCP) members said a Jamaat alliance goes against the party's ideology and democratic values.

title: Expert Panel, Multi-Period Probe: Key Takeaways From Supreme Court's Aravalli Order
content: The Supreme Court ordered the formation of a high-powered committee comprising domain experts to undertake an exhaustive and holistic examination of the issue.

title: Canada's Healthcare In Focus After Indian Man Dies Post 8-Hour Hospital Wait
content: The death of a 44-year-old Indian origin man in Canada -- who allegedly passed away without receiving emergency care despite an eight-hour wait at an Edmonton hospital -- has put focus on the Canadian healthcare system

title: Sydney Hero Recounts Moment-By-Moment How He Stopped Bondi Beach Shooter
content: Sydney shop owner Ahmed al Ahmed has recounted the harrowing moment he confronted one of the gunmen during the Bondi Beach attack in Australia that left 15 people dead.

title: Thorny Issues In 90% Done Ukraine Deal: Takeaways From Trump-Zelensky Meet
content: US President Donald Trump and his Ukrainian counterpart, Volodymyr Zelensky, held a high-stakes meeting in Florida on Sunday. The two leaders aimed to push forward negotiations to end the Russia-Ukraine war.

title: Teachers In Delhi Have A New Job: Count Stray Dogs
content: A list, accessed by NDTV, shows at least 118 government teachers from the Northwest district have been identified for the stray dog counting exercise.

title: "Finest Judges Prone To Errors": What CBI, Top Court Said In Unnao Rape Case Hearing
content: The Supreme Court stayed a Delhi High Court order suspending ex-BJP MLA Kuldeep Sengar's life sentence in the rape case of a woman - then a minor - in Uttar Pradesh's Unnao in 2017.

title: 'Adapt, Shrink Or Die': US Pledges $2 Billion For UN Aid As Trump Cuts Funds
content: The $2 billion is only a sliver of traditional US humanitarian funding for UN-backed programs, which has run as high as $17 billion annually in recent years, according to UN data.

title: Zohran Mamdani Has Bold Promises. Can He Fulfill Them As New York City Mayor?
content: On January 1, Zohran Mamdani will assume control of America's biggest city under that harsh spotlight, with the country watching to see if he can pull off the big promises that vaulted him to office and handle the everyday duties of the job.

title: "I Apologise": Lalit Modi Days After "Biggest Fugitives" Video With Vijay Mallya
content: A video of Modi attending Mallya's lavish birthday party in London went viral last week, in which he was heard saying: "We are the two fugitives, the biggest fugitives of India".

title: Live: Supreme Court Stays New Aravallis Definition, Unnao Rape Convict's Bail On Hold
content: The Supreme Court stayed the new definition of the Aravallis, while ordering the formation of a high-powered committee to conduct a multi-temporal investigation of the Aravalli hills and mountain ranges.

title: New Year Brings New Mayor For New York City, Zohran Mamdani
content: Just after the stroke of midnight on New Year's Eve, New York Attorney General Letitia James -- friend to Mamdani, foe to President Donald Trump -- will swear in the new mayor.

title: "Vandalistic": China After 'Friendship' Monument In Panama Canal Torn Down
content: Near the entrance to the Panama Canal, a monument to China's contributions to the interoceanic waterway was torn down Saturday night by order of local authorities.

title: Delivery Man Arrested For Sexually Harassing Woman At Bengaluru Mall
content: A 27-year-old delivery boy was arrested for allegedly sexually harassing a woman during the Christmas celebration at a mall here, police said on Monday.

title: Assam Minor Raped, Threatened With Acid Attack For Refusing Sexual Advances
content: The boy allegedly threatened the girl with an acid attack if she did not comply with his demands and also threatened an attack on her family members. The girl reportedly gave in to his constant pressure and threats, police sources added.

title: 'Full-Scale War With West': Iran President Ahead Of Trump-Netanyahu Meet
content: Iran is in a full-scale war with the United States, Israel and European countries, President Masoud Pezeshkian said ahead of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's meeting with US President Donald Trump on Monday.

title: 128 Flights Cancelled, 8 Diverted Due To Fog At Delhi Airport
content: At least 128 flights were cancelled, eight got diverted, and nearly 200 services were delayed at the Delhi airport due to dense fog on Monday.

title: 3 Months, 37,000 km: A Chinese Cargo Ship's Long Voyage To Deliver Cranes
content: After more than three months at sea and crossing three oceans, the vessel docked at the Port of Kingston in Jamaica in October.

title: Tiger Death In Madhya Pradesh Pushes Year's Toll To Highest Since 1973
content: Another tiger death has been reported from Madhya Pradesh, pushing the total number of tiger fatalities to the highest ever recorded in a single year since the launch of Project Tiger in 1973.

title: Fire engulfs two coaches of Tatanagar-Ernakulam express train in Andhra Pradesh, kills one
content: According to South Central Railway officials, coach numbers B-1 and M-2 were engulfed in fire and were badly damaged

title: NCP releases first list of candidates for Mumbai polls
content: Prominent names such as Manoj Dubey, Rizal Chitr Hilsoria, Babban Ramachandra Mande, and Ashok Nand Patade are also included in the list

title: Homo opportunisticus: The contingent, contested evolution of caste
content: Text of a guest lecture by writer Tony Joseph at the 84th annual session of the Indian History Congress at Government Brennen College in Thalassery, Kerala.

title: Vice President to arrive in Puducherry today
content: Mr. Radhakrishnan will also inaugurate a housing project completed at Kumaraguru Pallam under Smart City Mission and hand over the keys of five tenements to beneficiaries

title: The man who wore an IAS mask
content: Lalit Kishor faked being an IAS officer, allegedly spending ₹5 lakh a month on convoys and staff to take bribes from at least 40 people across four States while promising them government jobs and contracts. Amarnath Tewary visits his family in Bihar, who lives in poverty, and speaks about his early aspirations

title: Amit Shah's arrival in Guwahati postponed as his flight cancelled due to dense fog
content: Except for the night halt, the schedule of his programmes remains unchanged, one of the officials said

title: Nearly 200 U.P. villagers get rabies shots after consuming curd from buffalo that died after dog bite
content: According to the health department, no disease has spread in the village so far, and the situation is completely normal.

title: Haryana Police draws up an expanded crime and security strategy for 2026 with a focus on violent offenders
content: The DGP directed the Special Task Force (STF) to maintain a live watchlist of 100 violent offenders across the State

title: ‘Parivar together’: Ajit Pawar announces NCP-NCP (SP) alliance for Pimpri-Chinchwad Civic polls
content: Since the NCP split in 2023, the Ajit Pawar-led NCP has been in the Mahayuti alliance with the BJP and the Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena at the State level

title: Tamil Nadu needs to think beyond the metro
content: Modern mobility is not defined by infrastructure scale, but by access, affordability, and last-mile quality

title: Draft voters’ list out, BLOs still busy with mapping exercise
content: A total of 19.32 lakh people have been included in the ‘unmapped’ list in the State, of whom 2.1 lakh are in Ernakulam

title: IndiGo to begin flight services from Tamil Nadu to Navi Mumbai airport from December 29
content: An aviation source said the 186-seat all-economy class Airbus A320 services will be linked to the first phase of the Navi Mumbai airport’s operational hours, from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m.

title: Watch: Pakistan President Zardari reveals he was advised to ‘hide in a bunker’ during Operation Sindoor
content: Pakistan President Asif Ali Zardari has revealed that he was advised to hide in a bunker when India launched Operation Sindoor in May. Speaking at an event marking the 18th death anniversary of former Prime Minister Benazir Bhutto, Zardari recalled the tense moments during the India-Pakistan military escalation and praised Army chief Asim Munir’s response.

title: Punch marked gold coins from Vijayanagara-era unearthed near Jolarpet
content: Revenue officials also apprised the discovery of coins to Collector K. Siva Soundaravalli, who is the custodian of the district treasury as per the Indian Treasure Trove Act, 1878

title: H-1B visa reflects race, class dynamics of modern diaspora, says former JNU professor
content: R. K. Jain says migration shaped by political and cultural factors, and not economics alone, remains central to understanding social inequality

title: Winter bird count conducted in Vellore and nearby districts
content: Forest officials said most of the habitats in these districts are home for local birds that migrate within specified areas round the year

title: What election rules miss about shadow campaigns in India
content: An analysis of digital political advertisements during the Bihar Assembly election shows that third-party actors outspend official parties and candidates and achieve far greater visibility; this creates an accountability gap, allowing opaque funding and influence to persist beyond regulatory oversight

title: S. Krishnaswamy, master chronicler of subcontinental history
content: His magnum opus, the four-hour-long film traversing 5,000 years of subcontinental history, ‘Indus Valley to Indira Gandhi’, was released in December 1976.

title: Bengal SIR: Many permanently shifted, untraceable voters in Matua-dominated seats, says study
content: The community of Hindu refugees largely residing in North 24 Parganas and Nadia district have been apprehensive of the SIR since they lack legacy data

title: Red Fort blast: many victims, kin yet to get govt compensation
content: Kin of dead say despite submitting documents, they are yet to get any response from Delhi government; victims robbed of livelihood struggle, say authorities have asked them to wait

title: Uttar Pradesh SIR: Nearly 2.89 crore names deleted from draft voter list
content: Those excluded will have a chance to contest the deletion starting January 1, the State's chief electoral officer says

title: Acclaimed documentary filmmaker S. Krishnaswamy passes away
content: Dr. Krishnaswamy was the founder of Krishnaswamy Associates; he received the Padma Shri in 2009 and the Dr. V. Shantaram Lifetime Achievement Award in 2020

title: KWA’s 190-MLD water treatment plant awaits government approval
content: ‘The proposal, updated after a revision in the cost estimate, was put on hold following the announcement of the local body elections but is expected to move forward in the coming weeks’

title: After public uproar, right-wing attackers booked for assaulting Muslim youth in birthday party in Bareilly
content: Videos of the incident went viral in which a group of activists are seen storming the cafe, and police earlier acted against the victim, two Muslim youths and the cafe staff by issuing challan for disturbing peace

title: DMK stoutly opposes Congress leaders’ demand for a share in power in Tamil Nadu
content: Such an arrangement (a coalition government) will not work in Tamil Nadu, a highly placed source in the DMK says, indicating that the party leadership will remain firm in its decision

title: Indian officials deny Bangladesh police’s allegations about Hadi’s killers fleeing to Meghalaya
content: The Indian denial came soon after Dhaka police said that two suspects in the December 12 shooting of Mr. Hadi — Faisal Karim Masud and Alamgir Sheikh had crossed into Meghalaya

title: Airlines must enforce regulations without delay, cautions DGCA
content: Airline operators told to enforce  safety regulations effectively to avoid inconvenience to passengers

title: Congress invites applications for GBA elections
content: The applications will cost ₹50,000 for general category candidates and ₹25,000 for candidates from SC/ST communities

title: Pappanji to be set ablaze at two venues in Fort Kochi this New Year
content: The effigy put up by the Cochin Carnival Committee will be burnt at Parade Ground, while Gala De Fort Kochi, a local charity club, has received permission to burn the effigy it erected at Veli Ground

title: Vizianagaram real estate sees boom in 2025
content: Vizianagaram’s promixity to Visakhapatnam, where new projects of Google, Infosys and Cognizant among others are coming up, is a driver of the boom

title: Karnataka flags how VB G-RAM G Act will hurt State’s finances further
content: Over the next five years, Karnataka estimates that it would have to fund about ₹20,000 crore since the new VB-G RAM G Act replaced the MGNREGA, under which the Centre funded the entire cost.

title: Vellore Corporation to complete pipeline work on Chennai - Bengaluru Highway
content: Corporation officials said that as the service lane and Green Circle witnesses huge traffic flow, the civic body is allowed to undertake pipeline work between 11 p.m and 3 a.m

title: Ravens-Steelers on SNF to cap Week 18 slate
content: The NFL announced the full final-weekend schedule, with the marquee matchup between the Ravens and Steelers set to take place on "Sunday Night Football" on NBC, with the winner making the playoffs.

title: Purdy 'playing as good as it gets'; 49ers eye 1-seed
content: For the second week in a row, QB Brock Purdy accounted for five touchdowns as the 49ers outlasted the Bears 42-38 in a wild shootout on "Sunday Night Football" to set up a Week 18 showdown with the Seahawks for the NFC's top seed.

title: Kawhi puts up career-high 55 for streaking Clips
content: Kawhi Leonard scored a career-high 55 points as the Clippers extended their winning streak with a victory over the Eastern Conference-leading Pistons.

title: Pats clinch AFC East; Bills' reign ends with loss
content: The Patriots clinched their first division title since 2019 on Sunday, dismantling the Jets behind Drake Maye and then watching the Bills fall to the Eagles.

title: Garrett: Steelers' focus more on me than winning
content: Myles Garrett didn't set the NFL's single-season sacks record Sunday, but he believes the Steelers were more worried about preventing his record than getting the win.

title: Rivers: No regrets, even with Colts 0-3 in return
content: Philip Rivers says he has no regrets about unretiring even though the Colts have gone 0-3 in his starts.

title: LeBron, Luka 'set the tone' as Lakers right ship
content: With the Lakers reeling from a three-game slide, a calf injury to Austin Reaves and an air-it-out team meeting coming into Sunday's game against the Kings, LeBron James and Luka Doncic led a dominant 125-101 win to help right the ship for L.A.

title: Tank talk rubs Raiders wrong way amid latest loss
content: Raiders players' displeasure regarding the talk of tanking hovering over the organization intensified after a 34-10 loss to the Giants on Sunday.

title: 👀 How to do two coaching jobs during the CFP
content: Multiple CFP teams have coordinators taking head jobs elsewhere. For them, it's about compartmentalizing the chaos.

title: Tyler Shough for Rookie of Year? The Saints' QB is making his case
content: Sunday's win marked the fifth for the New Orleans signal-caller in just his eighth game as a starter.

title: Two vulnerable NFL sack records: Tracking pace for Myles Garrett (22!), Broncos' D (64!)
content: The Browns' vet edge rusher and Denver's defense have one week to rewrite the single-season sacks record book.

title: Despite red zone issues, Jaguars are one win from AFC South title
content: After a close win at the Colts, the Jaguars need a victory against the Titans in Week 18 to secure the division title.

title: Week 17 winners and losers: Maye, Henry shine in fantasy finals; Gibbs, Lamb disappoint
content: Drake Maye, Derrick Henry and Chase Brown came up big when it mattered most in Week 17, while Jahmyr Gibbs and CeeDee Lamb were among the biggest disappointments.

title: 'Thank you Browns': Ravens give shoutout to rival for saving season
content: Baltimore now controls its division fate after Cleveland stunned Pittsburgh -- and the Ravens made sure to say thanks.

title: Ian Darke's Best XI: Who stands out halfway through the season?
content: Will it be Donnarumma or Raya for best goalkeeper? Which two Sunderland players are in? Here are the season's top players as we near the halfway point.

title: Despite leading the league, Arsenal haven't looked convincing
content: Arsenal relied on an own goal for the fourth-straight game and their win vs. Brighton saw them do just enough.

title: The winner takes it all: Inside NFL division battles at the sportsbooks
content: At least two NFL divisions will be contested for during Week 18 of the NFL season after a wild Week 17.

title: Why Raiders' Alex Bachman lives in a guesthouse and has no attachments
content: Alex Bachman once found his locker empty before game day. Now he lives by rentals and no attachments.

title: A new United States champ; Three Stages of Hell for Rhodes vs. McIntyre
content: Friday's "SmackDown" saw a new champion being crowned and the Cody Rhodes-Drew McIntyre rivalry reaching a new level.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid rebuff Napoli's Mastantuono move
content: Napoli want Real Madrid midfielder Franco Mastantuono on loan, but he won't be allowed to move this month. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Case registered over Instagram reel showing use of crude bomb in Kerala’s Kannur
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in .

title: Unnao rape case: SC stays Delhi HC order granting bail to Kuldeep Sengar; ex-BJP MLA to remain in jail
content: The Supreme Court has halted the Delhi High Court's bail order for ex-BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar in the Unnao rape case.  The apex court questioned the suspension of his sentence, noting Sengar remains jailed for another conviction. The CBI had appealed the bail, highlighting the horrific nature of the crime against a minor.

title: World record! Bhutan bowler scripts history; becomes first to do the unthinkable
content: Bhutan's Sonam Yeshey made T20 International history by becoming the first bowler to take an eight-wicket haul, finishing with figures of 8 for 7 against Myanmar. This extraordinary spell dismantled Myanmar's chase, securing an 82-run victory for Bhutan and an unassailable series lead. Yeshey's performance surpasses all previous T20 International records.

title: 'Why are you attacking Hindus in B'desh?': Bengal vendor assaulted by mob in Odisha; rescued by cops
content: A street vendor from West Bengal, Arshad Mallik, was brutally assaulted and accused of being an illegal Bangladeshi migrant in Odisha.  He was rescued by police after a video of the incident went viral.  With assistance from a state minister and local police, Mallik was safely brought back home.

title: Billionaire exits: Florida guv on Bezos’ move; says Amazon chief's move hurt Washington budget
content: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis criticized Washington's tax policies following Jeff Bezos' relocation, arguing it significantly impacted the state's budget. DeSantis believes states without income tax, like Florida, hold a major advantage, warning that further tax expansion could drive more residents away. This comes as California considers a similar wealth tax proposal.

title: 'Horrific': Rahul condemns Tripura student's killing in Dehradun; accuses BJP of 'normalising' hate
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi blamed the BJP for the fatal assault on Tripura student Anjel Chakma in Dehradun, calling it a "horrific hate crime" fueled by "toxic content and irresponsible narratives." Chakma succumbed to injuries sustained in a December 9th assault.

title: Silver prices drop Rs 21,000 in an hour after hitting life-time high
content: Silver price crash today: Silver prices saw a sharp drop after hitting record highs, with MCX futures plunging Rs 21,000 per kg as profit booking set in amid easing geopolitical risks and higher margin requirements.

title: 'I thought I was the next Steve Jobs': Google founder's 'mindset' lesson for students
content: Google co-founder Sergey Brin revealed a key lesson from the Google Glass failure: rushing innovation can be detrimental. He emphasized that students, like his past self, often feel pressured to deliver before readiness, mistaking speed for progress. True success, Brin suggests, lies in allowing ideas and skills adequate time to mature, rather than performing readiness.

title: ‘AI agents are becoming a problem’: OpenAI CEO flags risks; offers $555K role
content: OpenAI is hiring a Head of Preparedness for $555,000, acknowledging AI's growing ability to find security flaws and impact mental health. CEO Sam Altman revealed models are "beginning to find critical vulnerabilities." The role addresses cybersecurity, biosecurity, and AI's psychological effects, following lawsuits and reports of AI-driven harm. This move signals a significant shift in the company's safety approach.

title: China’s new export rules: Silver prices soar; this is not good, says Musk
content: China's new silver export rules starting January 1, 2026, will restrict shipments. This is happening as global silver supply faces a deficit. Demand for silver in industries like electric vehicles and solar panels is rising. Physical silver inventories are shrinking. Experts predict this will further disrupt supply chains and increase prices for the white metal.

title: 'Dhurandhar' BO collection: Ranveer Singh starrer nears Rs 700cr on day 25
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' continues its impressive box office run, nearing the Rs. 700 crore mark with Rs. 692.04 crore collected. In contrast, 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Teri Tu Mera,' starring Kartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday, is struggling, having earned just over Rs. 24 crore domestically.

title: Indus Waters Treaty put on hold, govt clears another Chenab hydel project
content: India is advancing its hydropower potential on the Chenab River with the approval of the 260 MW Dulhasti State-II project in Jammu & Kashmir. This strategic move, following the suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, aims to harness the river's untapped capacity. The project, an extension of an existing facility, will contribute to India's hydropower generation goals.

title: Income tax emails rattle taxpayers! Refunds, ITR processing on hold - What’s happening?
content: Income Tax Department has been sending emails and SMSes warning that return processing and refunds are on hold due to flagged donations or deduction claims. These have unsettled taxpayers, particularly those with genuine claims.

title: Tiff turns violent: Drunk teens slash Odisha youth with sickles; post assault video online
content: A shocking incident unfolded near Tiruttani where a group of juveniles brutally attacked a 20-year-old Odia youth with sickles, filming the assault for social media. The victim, K Suraj, sustained severe injuries. Police apprehended the attackers, who were found drinking at a temple, and have registered a case of attempt to murder.

title: Emergency crews rush to house fire at Denny Hamlin’s parents’ home
content: A massive house fire erupted Sunday night at the Gaston County, North Carolina, home of NASCAR Cup Series star Denny Hamlin's parents. Two individuals were transported to a local hospital after being removed from the property. Firefighters battled difficult conditions, including a lack of hydrants, to control the blaze.

title: Hidden health risks of office coffee machines you should know about
content: Your office coffee machine might be a hidden health hazard. Unfiltered brews can elevate cholesterol due to compounds like cafestol and kahweol. Poor hygiene also poses microbial contamination risks. Opt for filtered coffee and ensure machines are regularly cleaned to mitigate these potential cardiovascular and respiratory issues. Stay informed about your daily brew.

title: Tech in 2026: The era of AI coworker and Connected Intelligence beckons
content: By 2026, AI will transition from a talking tool to an autonomous partner, managing tasks and workflows across industries. India is poised to lead this 'AI public infrastructure' revolution, with significant investments in cloud and AI capabilities. Expect a future where AI agents work alongside humans, enhancing productivity and driving measurable outcomes.

title: 'Mandhana threatened never to speak to Harmanpreet': Jemimah reveals why
content: India women’s team captain Harmanpreet Kaur broke into a bhangra while lifting the Women’s T20 World Cup trophy, a moment that soon went viral and won hearts across social media. The celebratory act, however, had a light-hearted story behind it.

title: India’s coaching centres come under mental-health regulation: What changed & why it matters
content: Noida administration is enforcing stricter rules for coaching centres. Student well-being is now a top priority. Institutions must ensure disciplined environments and adequate facilities. Trained counselors will be mandatory. CCTV cameras are required in all centres. This move follows national concerns about academic pressure and student suicides. Compliance is expected within 15 days.

title: VHT: RCB's Rs 7cr buy fails to fire; falls cheaply after huge mix up
content: Venkatesh Iyer’s dismissal came after a costly mix-up with Himanshu Mantri while attempting a quick single, leaving him short of the crease. The early exit once again brought focus on the 30-year-old, who has been under scrutiny following an eventful IPL auction cycle.

title: Woman beaten to death by husband, sister-in-law in Maharashtra
content: A shocking domestic dispute in Palghar's Virar West led to the alleged murder of 35-year-old Kalpana Soni. Her husband, Mahesh Soni, and sister-in-law, Deepali Soni, were arrested after a heated argument over dowry turned violent. The victim was reportedly attacked with a sharp weapon, and despite initial claims of an accident, medical reports confirmed foul play.

title: How honeymoon in Sri Lanka led to suicide of Bengaluru couple 1,000km apart
content: A 30-year-old man, facing dowry harassment and abetment to suicide charges after his wife's death, died by suicide in a Nagpur hotel. He had fled Bengaluru with his family due to threats from his in-laws. His mother also attempted suicide but survived.

title: Nagarjuna describes 2025 as ‘very satisfying’; ‘Glad sons found their happiness’
content: Actor Nagarjuna reflects on 2025 as a deeply satisfying year, marked by his sons' marriages and personal happiness. Professionally, he relished working with Dhanush and Rajinikanth, even embracing a villainous role in 'Coolie.' The re-release of his iconic film 'Shiva' also brought immense joy and reconnected with a new generation.

title: INSV Kaundinya: Navy’s engineless ship to embark on maiden voyage — all you need to know
content: The Indian Navy's stitched sailing vessel, INSV Kaundinya, embarks on its maiden voyage from Porbandar to Muscat, retracing ancient maritime routes. Built using traditional stitched-plank technology without modern propulsion, the ship highlights India's rich shipbuilding heritage and its historical connections with West Asia.

title: Record foodgrain production! Indian agri sector remains strong despite US tariffs
content: India's agriculture sector is poised for record foodgrain production in 2025-26, driven by strong monsoons and GST cuts on key inputs. Despite global trade headwinds and excessive rainfall in some areas, sowing has progressed well. Stakeholders anticipate major bills on seeds and pesticides in 2026 to address input quality.

title: ‘An apple a day’ — but at what cost? Kashmir's orchards raise health alarm
content: Kashmir's apple orchards face scrutiny as lawmakers and medical experts link decades of pesticide use to rising malignant brain tumours among orchard workers. Studies reveal high incidences of brain cancer in fruit-growing districts, with evidence of pesticide residues found in human blood, demanding urgent policy responses for worker safety.

title: Silver's sparkling rally! Spot silver hits record high; surges past $80 an ounce mark
content: Silver prices soared past eighty dollars an ounce on Monday. Tight supplies and growing industrial demand fueled this rally. Platinum also touched a record high. Investors are watching for further US interest rate cuts. Gold prices eased slightly after reaching new highs. Geopolitical developments are also a key focus for traders.

title: Rabies scare in UP: 'Raita' made from dog-bitten buffalo’s milk sends 200 to hospital
content: Nearly 200 residents of Piprauli village in Uttar Pradesh received anti-rabies vaccinations as a precaution after consuming raita made from the milk of a buffalo that later died of suspected rabies. The buffalo had reportedly been bitten by a rabid dog, prompting health officials to administer vaccines to prevent any potential risk, though no disease has spread so far.

title: Mind-body Monday: A gentle check-in for the Monday that already feels heavy
content: Mondays can feel heavy. This article encourages a moment of pause. Notice physical signs of stress. It suggests not forcing motivation but embracing pacing. Simple resets like a slow breath can help. Listening to your body's needs is key. Feeling heavy is human, not a failure. Kindness towards yourself is important. Staying connected to yourself is the goal.

title: 'Kindly relieve me asap': Pharma company finance president resigns over Delhi's toxic air
content: A pharmaceutical company's president of finance resigned citing Delhi's severe air pollution as the reason, highlighting health concerns aggravated by the smog. This incident reflects a growing trend of individuals and families reassessing their lives in the capital due to the worsening environmental crisis, impacting life choices and prompting moves to cleaner environments.

title: Watch: Mob storms student’s birthday party, thrashes Muslim guests in UP
content: Right-wing activists disrupted a birthday party in Bareilly, assaulting guests and raising 'love jihad' slogans over the presence of Muslim attendees. Police initially fined victims before registering an FIR against the attackers following social media outrage. Claims of 'love jihad' were found to be untrue.

title: What is the gold price outlook this week? Gold may head towards Rs 1,45,000 levels
content: Gold price prediction today: Any pullbacks in the gold price rally may be used for accumulation, says Manav Modi, Senior Analyst, Commodity Research at Motilal Oswal Financial Services. He believes that a decisive move above ₹140,000 may possibly open the way toward targets of ₹143,000–₹145,000.

title: Chennai airport mishap: Vijay gets mobbed as fans rush to get a glimpse of him - video
content: Thalapathy Vijay's return to Chennai from Malaysia's 'Jana Nayagan' audio launch saw him mobbed by enthusiastic fans at the airport. Overwhelmed by the crowd, the actor-turned-politician lost his balance and tripped near his car, but was quickly assisted by security and sustained no injuries. The event highlighted a stark contrast to the smoothly managed Malaysian function.

title: Explained: Why Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma are not playing VHT matches
content: Delhi are scheduled to take on Saurashtra at the Karnataka Cricket Association (KSCA) Stadium in Alur, while Mumbai will face Chhattisgarh at the Jaipuria Vidyalaya Ground in Jaipur. Both teams will be will be without the services of Kohli and Rohit, who had committed to playing only the first two matches of the competition.

title: Stocks to buy: What's the outlook for Nifty for this week? Check list of top stocks
content: Stock market recommendations: Sudeep Shah, Head - Technical Research and Derivatives at SBI Securities recommends buying Karur Vysya Bank, and Gujarat Mineral Development Corporation.

title: Beyond the big three - Who can stop the Alcaraz-Sinner takeover?
content: What's on the other side of the court? As the Alcaraz-Sinner duopoly threatens to take over tennis, replacing the famed Big Three, how does the men's game shape up in the New Year...

title: When the brain sees faces everywhere: How visual snow syndrome amplifies pareidolia
content: New research reveals people with visual snow syndrome experience heightened face pareidolia, mistaking everyday objects for faces more frequently. This condition, characterized by constant visual static, is linked to overactive neurons. While migraines can intensify these illusions, coping strategies and treatments aim to manage the overwhelming visual input.

title: Elderly residents trapped: Indonesia's Manado retirement home catches fire; 16 killed
content: Tragedy struck Manado, Indonesia, as a devastating fire at the Werdha Damai retirement home claimed at least 16 lives. Flames engulfed the building late Sunday, trapping many elderly residents. Emergency services responded swiftly, but the blaze left three others with burn injuries. Authorities are now investigating the cause of this horrific incident.

title: 'Still got flight': LeBron James’ unreal dunk vs Kings sends fans wild
content: LeBron James showcased his remarkable dunking prowess against the Sacramento Kings. His skills left fans in awe during his 23rd season. A viral clip captured a spectacular mid-air pass from Marcus Smart to James, who finished with an emphatic dunk. This performance, alongside Luka Doncic, is crucial as the Lakers aim to improve their 19-10 record and recover from recent losses.

title: Delhi AQI crosses 400: Dense fog disrupts flight ops across India
content: Thick smog and fog across northern India have led to significant flight delays, prompting the Ministry of Civil Aviation to issue a travel advisory. Airlines are urging passengers to check flight statuses and allow extra travel time as operations at select airports are impacted by reduced visibility and CAT III conditions.

title: States to gain Rs 17,000 cr under VB - G RAM G? Most will remain net gainers
content: The Viksit Bharat Guarantee for Rozgar and Ajeevika Mission Act is projected to boost state funds by nearly Rs 17,000 crore, despite concerns over a revised 60:40 Centre-state funding ratio. An SBI report indicates most states will be net gainers, with opportunities to enhance benefits through their own contributions.

content: the cowboys beat the Vikings in their 1975 playoff game . it was purported to be the quarterback's touchdown pass from Roger Staubach . he has long wanted a game-worn jersey of a Cowboys' Ring of Honor member .
